io.atomix.storage.buffer

Class AbstractBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.storage.buffer.AbstractBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bytes, BytesInput<Bytes>, BytesOutput<Bytes>, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ByteBufferBytes, FileBytes, NativeBytes, UnsafeHeapBytes, WrappedBytes

    public abstract class AbstractBytes
extends Object
implements Bytes
    Abstract bytes implementation.

    This class provides common state and bounds checking functionality for all Bytes implementations.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.atomix.storage.buffer.Bytes

      • order

        public ByteOrder order()
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Returns the byte order.

        For consistency with ByteBuffer, all bytes implementations are initially in ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN order.

        Specified by:
        order in interface Bytes
        Returns:
        The byte order.

      • order

        public Bytes order(ByteOrder order)
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Sets the byte order, returning a new swapped Bytes instance.

        By default, all bytes are read and written in ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN order. This provides complete consistency with ByteBuffer. To flip bytes to ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN order, this Bytes instance is decorated by a SwappedBytes instance which will reverse read and written bytes using, e.g. Integer.reverseBytes(int).

        Specified by:
        order in interface Bytes
        Parameters:
        order - The byte order.
        Returns:
        The updated bytes.
